title: U.S. Justice Dept. Investigates Killing of Shireen Abu Akleh in West Bank
description: The Justice Department inquiry is a shift by the Biden administration, which had said that Shireen Abu Akleh was probably killed accidentally, by gunfire from the position of Israeli soldiers.

title: C.I.A. Director Warns Russian Counterpart Against Using Nuclear Weapons
description: William Burns’s talks with Russia’s foreign intelligence chief are the most senior in-person meetings since the start of the war in Ukraine.

title: With Tensions Mounting, Biden and Xi Try a Warmer Tone
description: The American and Chinese leaders evoked years of personal contact as they met before the G20, seeking to pull back from outright conflict on a host of issues.

title: German Government Nationalizes Gas Unit Seized From Gazprom
description: The former Gazprom Germania, a subsidiary of the Russian state-owned gas monopoly, is deemed essential to Germany’s energy security.

title: Blinken to Visit China in 2023 After  Biden and Xi’s Meeting
description: The trip is aimed at keeping the lines of communication open and having frank exchanges about important issues at senior levels in order to avoid conflict.

title: Iran Unleashes Its Wrath on Its Children for Joining Protests
description: Hundreds of minors have been detained for joining the demonstrations, and many others have died in the crackdown, according to Iranian lawyers and rights activists.

title: Brazil, Indonesia and Congo Sign Rainforest Protection Pact
description: The three countries, home to more than half of the world’s tropical rainforests, have agreed to negotiate a “funding mechanism” for conservation.

title: Nova Scotia’s Race to Harness Tidal Power
description: The Bay of Fundy, between Nova Scotia and New Brunswick, has one of the world’s most powerful tides. Now, engineers and scientists hope to finally turn it into a clean energy source.

title: As the Pandemic Drags On, Americans Struggle for New Balance
description: As offices, restaurants and schools fill up, people are adjusting expectations and habits in another moment of deep uncertainty.

title: At the summit, Biden’s advisers provide clues about U.S. strategy on China.
CIA Director Warns Russia Against Use of Nuclear Weapons in Ukraine
description: The National Security Council said William J. Burns’s meeting was not in any way to negotiate or to discuss any settlement of the war in Ukraine.

title: Live Updates: Biden and Xi Meeting Ends as U.S.-China Tensions Rise
description: Amid growing disputes over Taiwan, Ukraine, technology and divergent visions of the world order, the leaders of the two superpowers are held their first face-to-face presidential talks.

title: Zelensky Visits Kherson After Russian Retreat
description: Days after Russia withdrew from Kherson, which had been a symbolic and strategic prize for Moscow, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine arrived in the city.

title: Alaa Abd El Fattah Is Alive, His Family Says
description: A note in the handwriting of Alaa Abd El Fattah, who has been on hunger strike for about seven months, read: “I began drinking water, my vitals are good.”

title: U.K. and France Sign New Deal to Stem Small-Boat Crossings
description: Britain has promised France tens of millions of euros to step up coastal patrols, a sign of thawing relations.

title: Turkey Accuses U.S. of Complicity in Istanbul Attack
description: Turkish police arrested a female suspect and accused her of entering from Syria to carry out the bombing on Kurdish orders. The U.S. is allied with a Kurdish-led militia in Syria.

title: Russia Denies Report that Lavrov Was Hospitalized Before G20 in Bali
description: Sergei Lavrov is representing Russia at the G20 meeting in place of President Vladimir V. Putin, who decided not to attend.

title: Ukraine’s Advances
description: Russia has suffered serious losses recently.

title: Hong Kong Demands Inquiry After Protest Song Is Played Before Rugby Match
description: “Glory to Hong Kong,” popular among pro-democracy protesters in 2019, was broadcast instead of the Chinese national anthem.

title: Iran Attacks Opposition Bases in Iraq’s Kurdistan Region
description: At least two people were killed and nine more wounded as security forces launched cross-border strikes at opposition groups they accuse of fueling protests across Iran.

title: Yellen Encourages Vaccinations in China as Covid Restrictions Slow Growth
description: With China’s strict pandemic policies stalling the economy at home and globally, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said American mRNA vaccines are at the ready.

title: Surrounded by Threats, Japan Rethinks Decades of Military Dependency
description: As it pushes to significantly increase defense spending and develop more of its own hardware, the country may nudge the balance of power in Asia.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Six killed in a deadly bombing in Istanbul.

title: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, Who Inspired ‘The Terminal,’ Dies in Paris Airport
description: Mr. Nasseri lived in Charles de Gaulle Airport for 18 years, sleeping on a bench, after he was stuck in limbo as a refugee. His life was the inspiration for the Steven Spielberg film, which starred Tom Hanks.
